title: What's the point of blind pick?
body: So in my experience in leveling up a smurf recently, blind pick just makes no sense. Everyone loads in and its complete chaos to see who can type their role out the quickest, even then people just go whatever they want anyway and how do u report that? no body is given a role so its just your word against theirs? it makes no sense.  It just seems like whoever has an SSD gets to type out their role first with the hope that someone doesn't "Troll" and go that position also.  Why not make Draft normals  for everyone including with limited champions and level so that when you are given a role you and someone else takes it riot can clearly see the system gave u that role not them and they are able to be punished?  Thanks.

Essentially it's the fast way to get into games, because draft can take a while in champ select. The other thing is of course bans. If you want to play a highly contested/banned champion then blind pick is probably going to be your best bet. Personally I ban Kat every game because I think she's bullshit, played a lot and I really don't like vsing her, and there are plenty of other champions with similar followings.

You can also report players for stealing roles in blind pick, and it is a punishable offence if they're doing it a lot, but comments in those kind of reports go a long way.

Okay, so in blind pick if someone steals your role, what do u report them under? and as i was saying before its kinda your word against theirs? like if they auto lock whatever they want and say nothing in chat while in game but ultimately ruining someone elses experience like how do u punish that? I feel like blind pick should be changed where you q up just like draft mode and u get a role u ask for but there are no bans. That way atleast riot can clearly see whos telling the truth and who isn't and a punishment can be handed down and it will be just as fast as the champ select is now.

Sometimes you can't like if you call a role but they were faster to lock it in, it's bm but they didn't steal the role. But if you've called a role and someone then locks in and plays it you can 100% report them for negative attitude. Just make sure you put in the comments that it's for role stealing in select. 

If you dodge the select, then you can submit a ticket to support to report them, but unless they're doing it a lot likely nothing will come from it, since only post game reports show on their history. Support also can't give you any info about suspensions handed out on other accounts so you'll get a generic "thanks for your report" reply.

Selecting roles for blind is something I'd be keen for, but I understand they don't want to merge the experiences too much. Remember that blind pick is also used by new players who may not know what roles are what yet, so picking roles would be difficult for them.

There is Normal Draft pick right now, but it may not always appear in game console.
You must be at least Summoner Level 10, and you must have at least 20 champions (including the free to play ones) to play that mode.
I wonder how many champions you own right now.
Blind Pick is for the lower leveled Summoners.

Edit: You don't get Smite until you are Summoner level 9, and draft pick allows only one role per champion, you are not allowed to have duo top in that mode.

It is possible to get duo top in Blind Pick, provided if you do not have smite.
